data.title: Best restaurant in redding
data.text: Whether you're in the mood for sushi or the flare of the grill, the food is top notch! We go here frequently for birthdays and special occasions. Volcano roll :)

data.title: Could have been much better for the price!
data.text: We have heard so many good things about this place, we finally decided to go. Unfortunately, I was not that impressed. The wait staff were very attentive, took the drink order quickly, then the meal order as well. The meal started with a broth/soup with a few slivers of mushroom (Japanese style for sure), followed by a decent small salad. They wash the lettuce well but fail to rinse it well. So it was a bit watered down. Didn't help that the dressing, as a result, thinned too much. Our cook, won't mention his name, came with the prepped dinner on his cart. Fried rice was his first part of the main meal.  Darned near tasteless. Then he started on the meats and seafood. He was serving two families. The vegetables, shrimp, steak and chicken all on grill at once, which was OK. My wife ordered steak and shrimp, grandson ordered shrimp, I ordered a chicken dish. My wife enjoyed her meal. My chicken had a strange taste thought it was a marinade or something floral. I did not eat but a couple bites. Had an upset stomach that my tums did not help. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

data.title: Just Like Back Home!
data.text: We have a Kobe Restaurant in HI. This eating place was as good as it is in HI. Excellent service with great tasting food. The serving sizes was very generous. Compared to HI, the prices were very reasonable

data.title: Gift card trial
data.text: First time here. I think only because some friends gave us a gift card. I am biased as I feel this town has maybe 2 or 3 really good places to eat. All the rest are sub par. I cannot comment on the grill tables as I don't like people enough to sit with strangers. Fun atmosphere especially for a group. I was pleasantly surprised by the food. All the meat was cooked perfectly with good flavor. I couldn't help thinking about how much my brain just enjoyed the msg vs actual real flavor. Other than that the food was good, good sized portions and the sushi was good as well. Except for the hard bits of shrimp shell but they were busy and had only one sushi chef. Our server was very attentive and polite. Great customer service and that to me is a big deal. I may go back. Just be prepared to have your hair and clothes smell like you have been frying in grease all day.

data.title: Great entertainment, good food
data.text:
We spent one night in Redding and ate here based on a recommendation.  The restaurant has a good vibe with friendly staff and nice decor.  They cook the hibachi dishes at your table and the cook is very entertaining with jokes and banter as well as juggling spatulas, etc.  A very fun experience.  

The food was good, but not what I'm used to in the Bay Area.  While everything was fresh and well prepared, the seasonings and textures didn't "pop" the way they do in a really good Japanese restaurant.  But, it was better than we expected to find in Redding.  

Would return next time I'm in the area....

data.title: Awesome food and tons of fun
data.text: What an awesome place. The food was excellent. They cook it right in front of you. The cooks are interactive with the diners. Lots of laughs and a tasty meal too.

data.title: Never on a monday
data.text: I wanted to love this restaurant, as I have in the past. Maybe I should have had the teppanyaki. Everyone loves that. But I ordered sashimi and a spider roll. Big mistake. The sashimi slices were flavorless slabs of sawfish, mako shark, white salmon (?!), and a prawn. Mushy and stringy. The soft shell crab was overcooked in oil that had been used once too often. It was a Monday, and I'm thinking the experienced chefs are off. The only saving grace was our server, who was extraordinarily polite and professional.

data.title: Good food and a good show
data.text: They cook the food at your table and put on a show.  In bigger cities there are many similar restaurants, but this is the only one in Redding.  The food and show are about average for this type of restaurant.

data.title: Great family fun for all ages
data.text: This Japanese Hibachi restaurant had the usual format but the Chef was attentive & the staff really personalized our experience. The scallops were huge and everyone in the family enjoyed their meal.

data.title: Our favorite place to eat!
data.text: We have been going to Kobe' since it's opening and love it still. The prices are extremely fair for what you get. I always order either the salmon or New York steak. The fried rice is incomparable. You can either sit on the dining side which is quiet and seats 2 - 6 or you can eat on the grill side for a large party or make new friends with other patrons. We always have the same waitress and feel like special guests every time.

data.title: Not impressed
data.text: Ive just never been impressed by the food here.  Ive been 3 times, and dont go back because the price is high and you get little amount of food for the money.  My boyfriend and I dumped some cash there once and looked at eachother and knew that we could have made something that tasted way better at home. He got a bento box of some sort. Its cool when the cooks cook in front of you with fire.  Staff is friendly.  Atmospehere is very elegant.

data.title: Pricey, but well worth it!
data.text: First time at this place and was there with a bunch of friends for a birthday. Wow - having food prepared as you watch a professional do his work is awesome! Be a little prepared for the quick wave of heat as they spark the flame, but after that it is a great show. The filet was done perfectly and the seafood was equally well-done. It's not so loud that you can't easily talk to your friends either. No parking at this restaurant - as it's on a corner, you need to do street parking, but you should be alright for dinner time. If you want dinner and a show, give this place a try.

data.title: Great atmosphere
data.text: Great place to take a date too.  Good food, excellent service.  It is a little pricey, but worth the money.

data.title: Great place to take friends
data.text: Kobe's is a great place to take friends as the food has always been great and most everyone loves the setting as you sit at a table with others and can have some great conversations and at the same time enjoy your food. Teen agers love it also as they love seeing the Chief putting on his show.

data.title: Very good food................service could have been better
data.text: Made a reservation for 14 people.  Service was really mediocre to start.  If you had never worked in a restaurant before and knew you had 14 people sitting down in 15 minutes, wouldn't you think...................what can I do to make this easier?  About 10 minutes after we sat down, the waiter thought about getting some waters??  Drinks took a long time, but could have gone faster if there was any teamwork with the staff. Server had no knowledge of Sake..........isn't this how the young man is making his living?  Isn't the goal to give prompt efficient service??  A lot of this comes down to poor training and lack of standards by management.  We had a lot of time to hang out as we were visiting family we had not seen in a long time.  Once the chefs started cooking they saved the day for the server.  Food was really good............nice experience but could have been amazing with a better server.

data.title: Best place to eat dinner in Redding, but not the best Japanese.
data.text: We love Japanese food, but found this place to have great atmosphere, but the bento box dinner was a little disappointing. The tempura was two large wide onion rings, a small piece of broccoli and two small sweet potatoes. The chicken teriyaki was drenched in the teriyaki sauce over the rice. It was presented with a fork thrown over the box and a Chinese spoon in the miso soup bowl. I would call this place a nice Denny's level Japanese restaurant, but for Redding, it is very popular as there are few other options. Still, I will go there again, it is far and above any other option we have found in Redding.

data.title: Anniversary Dinner
data.text: We made a reservation for dinner day before Valentine's Day to celebrate our anniversary.  They were running quite far behind.  Once we were seated though dinner was very good. The service was great and the chef was so good.  We sat on the teppanyaki side where you sit around a grill in a group of 8 and watch your dinner being cooked by a chef.  They are very funny and do a good job cooking.  We both had New York steak and shrimp, soup, rice and veggies.  We were so full when we left.  Other than having to wait because they were running late it was great.  This was our second time eating here and will go back again.

data.title: Definitely different with a show
data.text:
Been there 4 times, first two times was excellent. third time they forgot my son's entire dinner. And would not do anything about it except offered a free dessert. HAH. Returned after a year and a half and found it better like it was originally. Had a great meal. 
Only thing is you can get tired of the type of restaurant it is if you go to often. They have cut corners also with the chef's show while he cooks

data.title: Don't miss this great eatery Downtown
data.text: Tried this location twice while in Redding. Once tried take out and once with sit down. Both times were exceptional. Wide selection of food prep styles. Sit at the sushi bar to watch the kitchen action. Sit at the grill tables to be in the food prep floor show... Lotsa fun!

data.title: FANTASTIC PLACE
data.text: Our family tries to go to Kobe's as often as we can on a Sunday afternoon.  The food is delicious and the chefs cooking your food is a sight to behold.  I would recommend this place to native Redding people and to visitors coming to our area on vacation. You won't be disappointed.
